text: Aristion () was a surgeon of ancient Greece, probably belonging to the Alexandria School of Medicine. He was the son of PasicratesIn the extract from Oribasius, given by A. Mai in the fourth volume of his Classici Auctores e Vaticanis Codicibus Editi, Rom. 8vo., 1831, we should read υἱόν instead of πατέρα in p. 152, 1. 23, and Ἀριστίων instead of Ἀρτίων in p. 158, 1.10 who belonged to the same profession.Oribas. De Machinam. cc. 24, 26. pp. 180, 183 Nothing is known of the events of his life; with respect to his date, he may be conjectured to have lived in the second or first century BCE, as he lived after Nymphodorus, and before Heliodorus.Oribas. ibid. p. 180 ==References== Category:Ancient Greek physicians
title: Aristion (physician)
